title: I thought the new skin and ezreal skin rework was coming out this patch?
body: Inless im dumb and the patch didn't come out their is no pulsefire ezreal rework or caitalyin skin from what I can see

replies.body: You weren't wrong when you saw that those Pulsefire skins were supposed to be coming with this patch. They haven't hit the store quite yet, but they should be arriving in the next week or so. I'm not 100% sure since I don't really have a say in skin releases, but be on the lookout for them and you can check our [**sales page**](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/store/sales) for updates as well.
o ok thanks. I just saw the chroma for rengars skin and olafs skin so I got a little confused. but thanks for the clarification

For future reference, skins are usually enabled at a later date during the patch. (Frequently the day after patch day, or the week after).
Pulsefire Ezreal has been updated (I used it recently) as it's simply updates to existing content. 
Pulsefire Caitlyn will be out next week I assume. You should be able to see her skin in your Collection Tab (Not Shop), but unavailable to buy just yet. (I'm waiting on that one myself personally).

> [{quoted}](name=Evelyn Endwise,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=EQq1W6Qn,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-20T09:21:01.922+0000)
>
> For future reference, skins are usually enabled at a later date during the patch. (Frequently the day after patch day, or the week after).
> Pulsefire Ezreal has been updated (I used it recently) as it's simply updates to existing content. 
> Pulsefire Caitlyn will be out next week I assume. You should be able to see her skin in your Collection Tab (Not Shop), but unavailable to buy just yet. (I'm waiting on that one myself personally).

I think this is what primarily threw me off, before searching up a thread to find a reason behind the delay. I think I'm too use to it usually being within the first 24 hours of the patch's release. It's not too common I see something delayed by such a degree. I'll be patient and wait though. Would love to get the skin, but Cait's hasn't been my main in a long time. Wouldn't mind getting back into her though, she's still fun.

I think part of the reason the content is delayed is that Riot wants to be sure the patch is stable before they turn any new stuff on ingame. (They patch more frequently than any game I play does at least, which increases the possibility of bugs, with less QA time per patch).
Another part of it is, I think (and this is more opinion/theory) the need to space content out (when there are several skins in the patch of differing themes, although I don't think this has happened in a while lately). The goal here is to have peoples' eyes on one piece of content for one week, then another for the next week so that they might be tempted to spend again. League is the only game I play consistently where the comapany's only and main product is F2P, hence increased emphasis on buying RP content.

So long as you don't mind the upcoming nerf to her Runaan's interaction, I'd say give her another shot. She's meta right now due to the crit item buffs and is pretty good + I think her increased gameplay from her rework a while back made her a bit more fun.
Mained Cait on and off (depends on time to play, since my mechanics suffer after breaks) since I began in Season 2, and she's pretty much my numero uno favourite, so the skin is all kinds of hype for me lol.

> [{quoted}](name=Evelyn Endwise,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=EQq1W6Qn,comment-id=00000000000000010000,timestamp=2017-05-20T15:57:22.218+0000)
>
> I think part of the reason the content is delayed is that Riot wants to be sure the patch is stable before they turn any new stuff on ingame. (They patch more frequently than any game I play does at least, which increases the possibility of bugs, with less QA time per patch).
> Another part of it is, I think (and this is more opinion/theory) the need to space content out (when there are several skins in the patch of differing themes, although I don't think this has happened in a while lately). The goal here is to have peoples' eyes on one piece of content for one week, then another for the next week so that they might be tempted to spend again. League is the only game I play consistently where the comapany's only and main product is F2P, hence increased emphasis on buying RP content.
> 
> So long as you don't mind the upcoming nerf to her Runaan's interaction, I'd say give her another shot. She's meta right now due to the crit item buffs and is pretty good + I think her increased gameplay from her rework a while back made her a bit more fun.
> Mained Cait on and off (depends on time to play, since my mechanics suffer after breaks) since I began in Season 2, and she's pretty much my numero uno favourite, so the skin is all kinds of hype for me lol.

To be fair, my time with her was back in like, Season 3, maybe late Season 2, so I don't mind whatever they have planned for runaan's, to be honest. I do fully understand the reasoning though. I've been with the game long enough to see its ups and downs, and how problematic rushed releases can be immediately after a patch is pushed through for major content, such as a big skin or a new champion release. Hell, I still think the worst case that probably invoked the turning point that birthed the delays was Leona's special case, that happened to bring down the servers for about a couple of days.

My memory's hazy, but I seem to recall Hecarim's release knocking the EUW servers outta commission for about 3 days.
Damn, those were the days lol. Glad EUW managed to be completely stabilised since then. Can't remember the last time we've had major problems with releases.
o wait it has. e I guesss ill check out the new ezreal skin for a little then. thanks
